form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to reassert article I authorities over the Department of Homeland Security, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the DHS Accountability Enhancement Act.

subsection.text: Section 872 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 452) is repealed and the item relating to such section in the table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act is struck.
The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (b) and (c), respectively;

paragraph.text: in section 702(b) (6 U.S.C. 342(b)), by amending paragraph (4) to read as follows:
The Secretary may allocate or reallocate the functions of the Office, or discontinue the Office.
in paragraph (3) of section 2006(b) (6 U.S.C. 607(b)), by striking sections 506(c)(2) and inserting sections 506(b)(2).

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives October 23, 2017.
